newsitem.title: USA: Illinois Superconductor holds PCS tests.
newsitem.headline: Illinois Superconductor holds PCS tests.

text.p: Illinois Superconductor Corp said Tuesday it completed the first customer tests of its new Personal Communications Systems (PCS) receiver front-end.

The company said the tests were designed to demonstrate the product's ability to extend PCS cell site range. The results indicate the product could ultimately reduce the number of cell sites needed to provide complete coverage in uplink-limited PCS service areas by 20 percent to 30 percent, Illinois Superconductor said.
The company will now test the product's benefits in a wide range of PCS cell environments.
Illinois Superconductor specializes in commercializing high temperature superconducting technology.
Its shares closed down 5/8 Tuesday at 17.
